text:
Hey Millie, Happy Friday!

In terms of friends and colleagues with backgrounds in photography,  one friend who has an undergraduate degree in photography from NYU went on to get a masters in something like interactive media, and then she started her own really cool company with a few other women called Vid Code ( <http://twitter.com/vidcode|twitter.com/vidcode> ). I think her company is focused on teaching younger teenaged girls software development/coding skills through the subject of video/time based image processing. After her undergraduate degree, I believe she previously worked for this big name commercial photographer as a studio assistant, and as I understood it I think since she was not as personally interested in commercial photography, so she pursued further education to get into a separate field, but then found another area of interest (video and programming) which was probably heavily supported by her photography background. I imagine for her it felt necessary to pursue more education in order to make that switch, and although it might not have been a requirement for her to go back for more education in order to start that company, I think she got exposed to that opportunity as a result of going back for her masters, and the education she received from that masters degree probably really supports the focus of video/graphics programming at her company Vid Code.
